intro: Klasea sanandajensis, commonly known as the Sanandaj klasea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and limestone soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are often used in local traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
